intro: Hieracium froelichianum subsp. wimmerioides, commonly known as the Wimmer's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in meadows and grasslands, often in moist or calcareous soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
